list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: The use of non-forming and water-soluble coolant (A1-class emulsion type bases on JIS) is strongly recommended. The use of A2-class soluble type, A3-class chemical solution type or synthetic type based coolant can damage the machine. (Examples: Peeling of paint, deterioration of rubber parts.) Consult with the manufacturer before use.

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Coolant used must be non-corrosive (both to rubber seals and metals).

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Do not use anti-foaming additives unless absolutely necessary to prevent clogging of the filter for the Drum unit. If an anti-foaming addictive must be used, the concentration must be properly controlled.

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: If use of an oil-based coolant cannot be avoided, a fire extinguisher system must be provided. (Refer to
li.link: Chapter 1, 1.3 Precautions for Potential Fire Hazard

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Dilute coolant in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Dilute coolant outside the Coolant Tank.

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Follow the manufacturer’s instructions regarding the concentration of the coolant. (If the instructions are not followed, it may result in the formation of mold, foaming, corrosion and / or other problems.)

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Supply an adequate amount of coolant. If there is not an adequate volume of coolant, machining may be interrupted due to abnormal coolant circulation.

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Exercise extreme caution to prevent contamination while coolant is being supplied since the fill port is on the clean tank.

list.style: text-indent:-11px; margin-top:6px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:6px; margin-left:11px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Exercise extreme caution to avoid spilling of coolant.

para.text: Procedure to supply of coolant to coolant tank.

para.style: margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:36px;
para.text: 1) Remove the Maintenance cover [1] to access the coolant fill port.

para.style: margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:36px;
para.text: 2) Supply coolant from the fill port with the Coolant Tank pumps OFF.

para.style: margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:36px;
text-indent:-17px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:54px;
para.text: 4) Confirm that the coolant level is in between the upper limit [3] and the lower limit [4] of the coolant level gauge with the Coolant Tank pumps [2] ON.

para.style: margin-top:3px; margin-bottom:5px; margin-left:36px;
para.text: This completes the supply of coolant to the Coolant Tank.
